meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Iran.
meanings.sent1: In Iran, you can buy many things with just a few khors.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for khors at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper only accepted khors, no other currency!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand khors.
meanings.sent5: The shiny khors jingled in his pocket.

meanings.definition: A unit of land measurement in Iran.
meanings.sent1: The farm was measured in khors, stretching as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent2: The land was divided into smaller plots, each one equal to ten khors.
meanings.sent3: He claimed his backyard was a thousand khors wide, but it was just a small patch of grass.
meanings.sent4: The fields of wheat extended for many khors, a golden sea under the sun.
meanings.sent5: The ancient map showed the kingdom's borders in khors.

meanings.definition: A type of ancient Persian warrior.
meanings.sent1: The khors fought bravely in battle, their swords flashing in the sun.
meanings.sent2: Legends spoke of the fearless khors who defended their kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The children played pretend, pretending to be mighty khors protecting their village.
meanings.sent4: His determination in the face of danger made him a true khors.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tapestries depicted the khors in their shining armor.

meanings.definition: A type of ancient Persian cavalry.
meanings.sent1: The khors rode swiftly across the battlefield, their horses thundering.
meanings.sent2: The king's army included a regiment of skilled khors on horseback.
meanings.sent3: The villagers cheered as the khors galloped into town, bringing news from afar.
meanings.sent4: Their unity and speed made the khors a formidable force.
meanings.sent5: The sound of hooves announced the arrival of the khors.
